TopicTitle: Where can i find a sort of this "wall"?

Articles.Content:
Scrolling back in some very old screenshots of NovaSilisko i've found this pic:[http://i.imgur.com/GgPqTh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/GgPqTh.jpg) the thing that amazed me is that beautiful steep canyon/mountain

 Now my question is: in 0.90 there's some place with a very similar steep "wall"? Thanks in advance guys ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Do you by chance know which planet/moon this photo was taken on? My best guess would be somewhere on Duna, Moho or Tylo (from the colour of the planet/moon).

[http://m.imgur.com/a/RKPdE](http://m.imgur.com/a/RKPdE)

A giant asteroid-planet that never went in any officiale release ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> The heightmap for Harvest later went on to form the basis for Tylo's heightmap.

I am assuming that it should be on Tylo then, if it still exists. In the first image that you posted, in the upper right corner, it lists the latitude and longitude, maybe try and start your search there....

The only other current bodies in KSP that I think have large canyons would be both the Mun, and Dres, but nothing that looks quite like the canyons on Harvest did.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-02-19T00:04:54Z" title="02/19/2015 12:04  AM" data-short="9 yr">February 19, 2015</time> by SpaceExplorer**

So.. Tylo I probe is ready to launch!

Thanks anyway ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) if you have encoutered a similar canyon on another planets tell me! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

I will do for sure, and happy exploring! And sorry I could not be of much help, I have only been to Tylo a few times and did not explore any further than a few kilometers from the landing site, hopefully you find what you are looking for.
Yes no problem, i know that in this case is more a fact of lucky than real exploration ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
You may be able to find similar formations on Kerbin in the deserts...

![GgPqTh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/GgPqTh.jpg)

![images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR1mMBO2Tq5shE1mJrfD8JjVrUt7aL0INRZG36ahpk3jTeasUxt5g](https://encrypted-tbn1.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcR1mMBO2Tq5shE1mJrfD8JjVrUt7aL0INRZG36ahpk3jTeasUxt5g)

Huh? Anyone else? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

That looks really cool, and seems to be either Pol, Bop, or Tylo.
I recall a rather nasty 'wall' just south of the Armstrong Memorial on Mun... almost went over/down it in my rover.

> 
> [http://m.imgur.com/a/RKPdE](http://m.imgur.com/a/RKPdE)
> A giant asteroid-planet that never went in any officiale release ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Awww, damn. It looks really cool. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

ATTENTION: The wall's not in the game.

Though, nothing stopping you from exploring anyhow. There's plenty of interesting features throughout the Kerbol system. Check out Dres' and Duna's canyons. The Moholes. The Vallhenge.

Kerbin's smileyface at the bottom of the sea. (Good luck with that one... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

Heck, you might even be the one to rediscover the Magic Boulder.

(Devs... if you've been keeping it a secret for this long... ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif))

Yeah, I'm not sure of anything quite like that. Dres and the Mun both have steep-walled canyons, but they're grey of course. Pol has some steep mountainsides, but nothing as sheer as that. Kerbin has some mountain faces that are similarly sheer, but not as extensive.

I just realized that most people never really explored Tylo, i mean, i know a bunch of stuff about most planets, like the giant canyon on duna, the giant mountain on Eve which helps to reduce the ÃŽâ€v necessary to get out, even the Mohole.

But Tylo's surface is almost unknown to most people, i never really saw a Tylo exploring mission, that's weird...

Uhm, time to explore a certain moon!

Anyway guys maybe i didn't explain it very well in the first post but i don't want the SAME canyon, something similar in another planet ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Build some rovers and get looking, son.

Perhaps this will help you in some way:

![Gui_Tylo_ISA_Topo.png](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/w/images/0/09/Gui_Tylo_ISA_Topo.png)

Topographical map of Tylo. The craters with the > and the X look interesting.
I found an extremely steep and tall cliff on the Mun, sorta near the north pole (maybe 70 degrees north?) in one of the Highland Craters. It was much more extreme than the cliff pictured above.

![Psj5NE3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/Psj5NE3.jpg)

This is only one wall of the crater, and the screenshots *don't* do it justice. I think the other side is even higher, and almost as steep of an angle. It's on Mun at 69 50'N 115 25'W.

[http://www.kerbalmaps.com/](http://www.kerbalmaps.com/)

On the Mun.

18.2813, -50.4492 - The Canyon

-82.2063, 102.9305 - A big deep hole with a surprise at the bottom.

Wow amazing!

Thanks guys ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I have been waiting for this moment....

![tumblr_inline_mntqitwNSf1qz4rgp.gif](https://media.tumblr.com/05150a19cbdc4bde0b2cdc4a70f4a82b/tumblr_inline_mntqitwNSf1qz4rgp.gif)

[http://youtu.be/Urhw_kPDkoo?t=8s](https://youtu.be/Urhw_kPDkoo?t=8s)
